You're not sad they didn't keep the Soul control part of his ult ? It feels like Swain rework to me. By that I mean : even if the rework is great, I feel like they neglected a key part of the kit (For Swain they scrapped everything tbh... it's not that bad for Morde) . From my understanding, the project was iceboxed for months because they kept trying to keep the soul ult, but what's your opinion on it ?

Smacking people with a mace ? Still there.
Magic Aoe ? Claw is there
Old W ? Passive now
Shield : New W and feels more predictable to play against from their wording.
But the ult ? I feel like the soul slave part was important.

EDIT : Why the downvotes ? it's a legit question, I like the new ult ! Been following MM threads for a while and I thought Soul crushing/Control was core to Morde, but I'm wrong fine.

I don't mind losing the ghost at all.

It actually undermined Mordekaiser's theme since he was heavily reliant on a thrall than his own prowess, made him too much of a backline commander instead of this Indestructible Warlord.

He's everything I ever wanted and I've know that the moment Riot flew me in to playtest him.

Not MM, but I really don't see how they could have kept it. It was the source of nearly every bug he had in his previous (technically current but w/e) iteration.

Like, sure, it was cool and all, and hilarious to use it to turn an enemy gank into a double kill, but it honestly was probably unsalvageable, not in the way that previous deleted parts of kits were (Such as Aatrox's old W), but because the mechanic was way too open to letting new bugs in with every new way to auto. For every new champion with any on-attack or on-hit effect, it opened up a path to a new bug. And sure, Riot could have made it far less spaghetti this time around, but I doubt they could have fixed it for good. A new champion would come out and it'd cause problems with it.
{{champion:517}}  and yet he exists.  any time a new champion is created, he has to be updated
Nope, Riot *explicitly* did a huge amount of frontloading on him so they didn't have to go "what about sylas?"
how is that different from the ghost?

One ability is easier to account for than having to make sure a mini champion doesn't fall apart.

All Riot has to do is go "Yeah make this AD into AP unless there's already an AP ratio" and it's good on Sylas. Broken, perhaps, but not overly bugged. There's no chance of it getting stuck on one particular kind of on-hit effect or of dumb AI or any of the other issues present in it.

And that does bring up the other issue - Summons can feel like shit. Either the AI makes it a no-skill autowin or the AI's fucking useless.

The only thing I'll really miss about his ult is the dragon. That was one of the first things I saw in this game that really made me go "wow, that's pretty cool".

I'm excited that I'll be able to send people to the fucking shadow realm now, though.

The desing is nice and skills look cool, but what the hell are again these free s**t that champion has to have like 5 passives on top of a passive?

Just on a notion: Sorc Shoes{{item:3020}}  + Void staff{{item:3135}}  + E passive + Morello{{item:3165}} : 18% + 40% + 25% + 15% = 98% magic penetration.

Might as well remove all MR items from the game. Slam a Guinsoo's{{item:3124}}  on top of that and you've got pretty much a pure true damage build.

Have fun with your upcoming 6 month nerf streak after you try cheese permabanned Morde{{champion:82}}  for the first week. :)

Power creep wtf. I guess you can always overbuff Fiora{{champion:114}}  so you can have something to 1v1 that thing. I'm sure that rework will be as successful than Morde botlane.

Sorcs and Morello are flat pen not percent pen, so it’s actually 65% + 33 flat.  Also, Rageblade’s mpen shares a unique passive name with Void Staff’s pen, so they don’t stack - you only get the stronger version, Void Staff’s.

However, this does mean that a full pen Morde will deal true damage to anything with 94 or less MR.  120 MR will become 21, and 200 will become 57.

And unless he builds on-hit, his single target damage actually looks lower than before thanks to the loss of triple-bonk.  Unless you are isolated, then maybe...

We shall see.
